intro: Cereus speciosissimus var. triumphans, commonly known as the Queen of the Night, is a member of the Cactaceae family native to South America. It is a nocturnal bloomer, producing large, fragrant white flowers that open only at night and close by dawn. The plant has a tall, spiny stem with areoles that bear both spines and flowers. Its flowers are typically 10–15 cm in diameter and have a sweet, intoxicating fragrance. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to encourage flowering.
